fear: Get involved with the masses; sell abstract ideas.
goal: The power generated by authority, position and formal roles.
its_value_for: Thorough follow-up to carry out your work constantly and persistently, individually or in small groups.
more_effective_if: Be more flexible; accept others; if I participated more with others.

Objective and analytical, the researcher is “embedded in reality”. Usually secretive, he calmly and steadfastly follows an independent path toward his stated goal. The Investigator is successful in many ways, not because of his versatility but because of his dogged determination to go all the way. He seeks a clear purpose or goal on which he can develop an orderly plan and organize his actions. Once embarked on a project, the Investigator struggles tenaciously to achieve his goals. Sometimes it is necessary to intervene to change your mind. It can be seen by others as stubborn and stubborn.

The researcher performs wonderfully in tasks of a technical nature that imply a challenge, where he can use and interpret real information and draw conclusions. It responds to logic rather than emotion. By selling or marketing an idea, you can achieve great success if your product is concrete.

The Investigator prefers to work alone and is not interested in pleasing others. It can be considered extremely direct, abrupt and tactless. In evaluating his own ability to think, the Investigator evaluates others for their objectivity and logic. To improve the effectiveness of your relationships with people, you need to develop a greater understanding of others, including your emotions.
under_pressure: It tends to internalize conflicts; remember the wrong done to you.
